programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day five of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including alpine skiing and snowboarding. America's Michaela Shiffrin won gold in the alpine skiing women's slalom at the age of just 18 four years ago, and is fancied to successfully defend her title today at Yongpyong Alpine Centre. Also in this session, Shiffrin's compatriot Shaun White is looking to go one better and win his third successive snowboard halfpipe gold medal at Phoenix Snow Park

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents continued coverage of the opening events on day five of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Dan Walker and Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of the latest events on day five of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including biathlon, luge and curling. The women's 15km individual biathlon is due to take place at Alpensia Biathlon Centre in this session, while the Olympic Sliding Centre will play host to the second and final heat of the doubles luge competition, and the round-robin stage of the curling tournament continues at Gangneung Curling Centre

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston is on a mission to find Liam, and Sid is furious when a receptionist takes things too far and starts playing cupid with his patients

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: After the new mayor, Una Drake, launches an initiative to clean up the town of Lighthaven, she forcibly closes the Punch and Judy stall. Later, the man behind the stall is found dead on the beach, and when Jane meets with Una, she finds her rude and abrupt. However, in the small hours, Davey and Jane are called to the scene of a second death - the mayor has been found beaten in a hotel room. The pair search for a link between the two deaths, and Jane's quest for the truth puts her life in danger. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes house-hunting with two brothers, one of whom is hoping to buy a country home in Oxfordshire on a budget of £675,000. Plus, a look at Victorian pleasure boating

programme.title: Get Away for Winter
programme.desc: Friends Tanya and Luisa want to swap the cold of Tyne and Wear for the sunshine of Ibiza, and are shown four rental properties on the Spanish island by local property expert, Julia

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Philip Serrell and Catherine Southon hunt for items of interest in the West Country, with Phil quizzing a local fisherman, and Catherine changing her strategy

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Sheriffs Tommy and Craig decide to remove two vehicles from a debtor's driveway, but it is not going to be an easy task. Meanwhile, Lawrence and Kev are on the hunt for a stables manager who owes money, but upon arrival they find the property deserted, apart from the horses. Elsewhere, the sheriffs try to help a customer who took his car to a garage for repairs and has not seen it since. Last in the series

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: New series. Cameras explore some of the most breathtaking places on Earth, following the lives of some of the people who call these extraordinary places home. In the first episode, cameras follow Yak-herder Thokmay Lowa as he leads his herd through one of the most treacherous mountain passes in the high Himalaya. Elsewhere, the programme follows members of Inuit communities in the Canadian Arctic as they take part in the hazardous mussel harvest, and people in Siberia searching for mammoth tusks, now released from the Siberian Permafrost after thousands of years

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Five-time Paralympic gold medal-winning equestrian rider Natasha Baker, double Taekwondo Olympic medallist Lutalo Muhammad, long jumper Jazmin Sawyers and cycling legend Chris Hoy join host Sue Barker and regular team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell on the quiz

programme.title: And They're Off for Sport Relief
programme.desc: Richard Arnold, Amber Davies, Maggie Alphonsi, Iwan Thomas and Rav Wilding all put their athleticism to the test, as Ore Oduba presents another round of the sporting challenge. The stars are tasked with competing in a series of bizarre races, while members of the public answer general knowledge questions and try to predict which of them will come out on top

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day six of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including alpine skiing and snowboarding. One of the blue riband events of the Games - men's downhill skiing - finally gets under way at Jeongseon Alpine Centre after being postponed on day two, with Austrian Matthias Mayer bidding to defend the crown he won in Sochi four years ago. Plus, American alpine skiing sensation Mikaela Shiffrin, who is predicted to become one of the stars of the Games, begins her quest to win multiple medals in Korea in the giant slalom at Yongpyong Alpine Centre, after the event had to be postponed on day three due to high winds. Meanwhile, France's Pierre Vaultier is also looking for back-to-back golds in the men's snowboard cross competition at Phoenix Snow Park

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents continued coverage of the opening events on day six of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further coverage of day six in PyeongChang, South Korea, including China v Great Britain in the round-robin stage of the women's curling Gangneung Curling Centre, as Eve Muirhead's team look to build on their triumph at the 2017 European Championships. Also taking place is speed skating, biathlon and the women's aerials

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston tries to get some answers from Liam, Ben makes a big announcement and Ruhma helps a troubled young man who fears for the future of his relationship and his unborn child

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A volunteer in the Lighthaven lifeboat crew drowns following a hoax call-out, and Jane suspects foul play, despite Davey's scepticism

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Devon helping a fun loving couple with £475,000 find a country home which suits their ambitions, and also tries her hand at traditional glass blowing

programme.title: Get Away for Winter
programme.desc: Mother and son Michelle and Jason from Southport want to spend the winter on Lanzarote - but they need a rental property matching two different tastes. Gloria Hunniford narrates

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Philip Serrell has a ride on a replica steam vehicle as he and Catherine Southon travel along the Cornish coastline in search of more antique bargains

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A desperate Max tries to get answers from Lauren about Abi's funeral, but she stands her ground and insists that Tanya will not go if he is there. Kim has a bright idea how to solve the Hubbards' financial problems, Whitney finds Halfway with his hand in the till at the Vic and the rivalry hots up between Masood and Kathy. A careless comment by Robbie leads to an argument with Donna

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan and a team of scientists learn more about various species through the use of animal bodycams. In the Atlantic, they reveal why a large number of devil rays gather near the Azores archipelago every summer. Footage of brown bears in north-east Turkey uncovers a fight between two males and a touching courtship scene, while in southern France, night-vision cameras are used to prove whether guardian dogs are an effective way of protecting sheep from wolf attacks. Last in the series

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Another mystery for Ardal O'Hanlon as Irish detective Jack Mooney working on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. And so it appears this week as someone from JP's past is caught red-handed at a murder scene, raking up old memories for the young officer. But can the DI unravel the complex mystery to get at the truth? Tobi Bakare and Danny John-Jules co-star, with guest appearances from Ralph Brown and Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Yeovil, Somerset, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience

programme.title: Drugs Map of Britain
programme.desc: Examining the drug Fentanyl, a pain reliever 50 times stronger than heroin and is on the rise in the UK. Fentanyl is 50 times stronger than heroin and is the drug linked to the death of rock star Prince. It's reported that Fentanyl has claimed the lives of at least 60 people in eight months. The programme reveals its effect in the city of Hull, seeing the effects it has on users as well as seeing what steps the authorities are doing to try to stop its illicit circulation. Last in the series

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day seven of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including skeleton, figure skating, snowboarding and alpine skiing. Yun Singhbin will be aiming to win the host nation's first gold in a sliding event should he be involved as expected in the men's skeleton final at the Olympic Sliding Centre. In figure skating, the men's single short program gets under way at Gangneung Ice Arena, with American teenager Nathan Chen and Japan's defending champion Yuzuru Hanyu among the favourites. Also taking place is the seeding round of the women's snowboard cross at Phoenix Snow Park, while Norway's Kjetil Jansrud is looking to defend his alpine skiing super-G title at Jeongseon Alpine Centre, after the event was postponed on day six

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents continued coverage of the opening events on day seven of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further coverage of the latest events on day seven of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including skeleton, curling, ski jumping and freestyle skiing. Defending champion Lizzy Yarnold and her British compatriot Laura Deas begin their respective bids for glory at the Olympic Sliding Centre in the heats of the women's skeleton. Plus, Great Britain face Sweden in the round-robin stage of the men's curling, and the men's ski jump and women's freestyle skiing aerials take place

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ben upsets Will's plans for the future, while Heston endangers himself in a bid to unmask the truth about Liam. Zara gets caught up in a life-or-death situation involving two women

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A local journalist tries to convince the people of Lighthaven there is a big cat on the moors, but nobody will believe him - until the discovery of his mauled body

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton assists a couple as they look for a property in North Wales on a budget of £400,000. Away from the search, the presenter rides the Great Orme tramway

programme.title: Get Away for Winter
programme.desc: Chris and Victoria from Cornwall enlist the help of local property expert Dolores in West Palm Beach to find a perfect rental home for them and young son Jacob in Florida

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Philip Serrell make their way to Somerset for the final auction. On the route, Catherine discovers how Isaac Newton revolutionised coins to frustrate forgers and Phil enjoys a little lesson in culture at the Bristol Old Vic

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones is joined by a guest co-host for the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenters Alex Jones and Rick Edwards, comedian Greg Davies and performance poet John Cooper Clarke join forces with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show in which participants attempt to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The day of Abi's funeral arrives and the residents of Albert Square prepare to say their farewells, but with Max more desperate than ever to say goodbye to his daughter, will all run smoothly? Back at the Vic, Linda realises Halfway left his bag behind, so Whitney sets out to track him down

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners

programme.title: Requiem
programme.desc: Aron Morgan lodges a complaint against Matilda for harassing Davey, and the police are unmoved by Matilda showing them what she believes is a clue to Carys' disappearance. Rose is pushed to breaking point as old wounds are reopened, Ed gets jittery as Trudy gives him the cold shoulder, and Graves becomes increasingly suspicious that he's hiding something. Sylvia reveals the peculiar ancestry of the Dean family, Hal identifies the source of the eerie music on the audiotapes, and Trudy remembers a crucial detail about the day Carys vanished. Psychological thriller, starring Lydia Wilson

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by Margot Robbie and Allison Janney, both nominated at this year's Oscars for their roles in true-life drama I, Tonya. Also on the sofa is Alicia Vikander, Oscar-winner for The Danish Girl, who is currently starring as Lara Croft in the new Tomb Raider movie. Plus, singer-songwriter Camila Cabello performs Havana. Providing there's time, the host will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: The Young Offenders
programme.desc: Conor and Jock's friendships with Principal Walsh's daughters intensify, causing awkward tension between the lads, the principal, and Linda and Siobhan themselves. Mrs Walsh is intent on her husband giving the lads a chance, but despite everyone's best intentions, things get out of hand when the duo crash a Walsh family barbecue. Comedy, starring Alex Murphy and Chris Walley

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including figure skating, curling, and freestyle skiing. The men's single free figure skating final takes place at the Gangneung Ice Arena, and Eve Muirhead's Great Britain take on Denmark in the round-robin stage of the women's curling. Outdoors, Team GB's Katie Summerhayes and Izzy Atkin will hope to be involved in the freestyle skiing slopestyle final

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents continued coverage of the opening events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. With Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty. Including NewsWatch at 7.45

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further coverage of the latest events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including the women's skeleton, plus short track speed skating. The women's skeleton is scheduled to come to a conclusion with the third and fourth heats at Olympic Sliding Centre, where Great Britain's Lizzy Yarnold will hope to be in contention for a gold medal having stood atop the podium in Sochi four years ago. Elsewhere, the finals of the women's 1500m and men's 1,000m short track speed skating finals are due to take place at Gangneung Ice Arena, with Team GB's Elise Christie hoping to appear and perform well in the former

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests discuss the fifth round of the FA Cup, which got under way with two matches last night, and also review the week's headlines

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present continued coverage of the latest events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including the women's skeleton, curling and ice hockey. The women's skeleton is due to reach a conclusion at Olympic Sliding Centre, where British hopes will rest on the shoulders of reigning champion Lizzy Yarnold, as she attempts to repeat her success of 2014. Elsewhere, the women's British curling team are due to face South Korea in their sixth contest of the round-robin stage at Gangneung Curling Centre, while the Gangneung Hockey Centre plays host to an intriguing match in the men's ice hockey competition, as the USA face a team made up of Russian players unable to compete under their national flag

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the FA Cup, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC

programme.title: And They're Off for Sport Relief
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Tyger Drew-Honey, Sharron Davies, Sam Quek and Zoe Lyons all put their athleticism to the test, as Ore Oduba presents one last round of the sporting challenge. As ever, the celebrity contestants are tasked with competing in a series of bizarre races, while members of the public answer general knowledge questions and try to predict which of them will win. Last in the series

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: With the PyeongChang 2018 Olympic Winter Games well under way, Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host an appropriately themed edition of the unorthodox game show, challenging a range of figures associated with either snow sports or the games themselves to come up with the least likely correct answers to questions posed to members of the public. Featuring Jayne Torvill, Clare Balding, Jenny Jones, Amy Williams, Graham Bell, Rhona Howie, Robin Cousins, Wilf O'Reilly and Eddie `the Eagle' Edwards

programme.title: All Together Now
programme.desc: Rob Beckett gives another selection of vocallists take to the stage, hoping to impress the 100-strong panel of judges enough to get them to sing along with their performance. This time, the would-be stars tackle Pharrell Williams' ubiquitous hit Happy, Climb Every Mountain from The Sound of Music and Skyfall from the 007 film of the same name. The experts are also encouraged to join in with renditions of 1970s classics in the form of Candi Staton's Young Hearts Run Free and the Jackson 5's Who's Loving You

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ethan tries to solve the trolleys in corridors problem by creating a new Clinical Decisions Unit, but shifting the surplus patients to a new department fails to fool the anonymous Rage in Resus blogger, who continues to expose the weaknesses of the ED. Meanwhile, Gem proves her worth on her first day as an ED porter, and when no less than nine patients from a single retirement home are admitted with chest pains, the staff try to find out whether they have anything in common other than their address

programme.title: Troy: Fall of a City
programme.desc: New series. An encounter with the gods binds the fate of young herdsman Paris to that of his home city of Troy, and when he is granted the honour of visiting Sparta as a guest of King Menelaus, he falls in love with the beautiful queen Helen, with far-reaching consequences that threaten to bring an empire to its knees. David Farr's historical epic, starring Louis Hunter, Jonas Armstrong, Bella Dayne, David Threlfall, David Gyasi and Joseph Mawle

programme.title: Match of the Day: FA Cup Highlights: 17/02/2018
programme.desc: Action from the latest fifth-round matches, which included Brighton & Hove Albion v Coventry City and West Bromwich Albion v Southampton, featuring analysis of the main talking points and post-match reaction from managers and players. Plus, a look back at the two matches from Friday night, which were Leicester City v Sheffield United and Chelsea v Hull City

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Aussie comic Adam Hills hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by actress, comedienne and shoe-lover Andi Osho and funnyman-turned-EastEnder Terry Alderton

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: The year has almost turned full circle since the death of her other half, and as Cathy finalises preparations for a New Year's Eve party, Kelly and Jason arrive back arguing. Michael turns up, and as Cathy attempts to sort out Jason and keep festivities moving, she also tries to find the right moment to give him his Christmas present. Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan star in the subtle family comedy in which a woman makes plans to move on from the death of her husband and find love second time around. Last in the series

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents recent action, including Wigan Warriors v Hull FC from the WIN Stadium in Wollongong, Australia, and Leeds Rhinos v Hull Kingston Rovers at Elland Road

programme.title: Charles I's Treasures Reunited
programme.desc: Brenda Emmanus explores the art collection of Charles I, much of which is being reunited for a unique exhibition - the first time since his execution

programme.title: The New Builds Are Coming: Battle in the Countryside
programme.desc: Richard Macer heads to Oxfordshire, one of the most expensive counties in the country, to investigate if building estates across the British countryside can help the UK's struggling housing market. In the first episode, he travels to the small village of Culham, where local residents are furious at government plans to supersize their village and build 3,500 new homes

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford and husband Steven discover if fish-rich diets have deposited high levels of mercury in their blood, and Chris Bavin reports on the health of vegan kids

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Former cricketer David Gower and comedian and TV presenter Nick Hancock tour Hampshire for antiques and collectibles that will raise them money at auction in Sidcup, with expert help from Charlie Ross and Philip Serrell. Along the way, David and Charlie board HMS Warrior, and Nick and Phil go hunting for brown trout

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Joining the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day five of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including curling and Nordic combined skiing. In women's curling, Great Britain take on Olympic Athletes from Russia in a crucial round-robin match at Gangneung Curling Centre. Elsewhere, Johannes Rydzek is the favourite for the title in the men's Nordic combined skiing normal hill competition, having won all four golds on offer in last year's World Championships

programme.title: Animal Park Easter Special
programme.desc: The keepers are locked in a battle of wills with a Canadian timber wolf, who keeps trying to escape his enclosure, and special cameras are set up to watch the lions after dark(c)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties in Croydon in Surrey, Donnington in Shropshire and Derby

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Military serviceman Mathew and his fiance Phillipa are ready to leave the UK behind and set off for a trial week in Perth, to sample the lifestyle they could lead if they moved

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The firm races to find the family of one of their most valuable cases ever, and the second investigation leads the team to hear about the bravery of unsung wartime heroes

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts as two friends and a couple test their antiques knowledge at Spitalfields Market in London, with David Harper and Christina Trevanion on hand to help

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present further coverage of the latest events on day five of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South South Korea, including curling, ice hockey, and luge. Great Britain take on Canada in a round-robin men's curling fixture at Gangneung Curling Centre. The match is a repeat of the 2014 final, which saw the Canadians take gold for the third Games in succession. There is also ice hockey and luge action, and a round-up of all the key moments from earlier in the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in the city of Los Angeles, where he heads for the Warner Brothers studio, before taking a walk down the famous Walk of Fame. Outside of the city, Michael travels to San Marino to visit The Huntington, a cultural and research centre with libraries, galleries and over a dozen botanical gardens

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the fifth day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. American's Shaun White and Mikaela Shiffrin were among the star names expected to be in action as they looked to defend their respective snowboardin halfpipe and alpine skiing slalom titles

programme.title: Tom Kerridge: Lose Weight for Good
programme.desc: With some of the dieters finding it hard to resist high calorie lunch options when they are at work, Tom creates recipes to help them resist temptation away from home. The chef demonstrates how to make a low-calorie popcorn and chocolate snack bar with marshmallow, sweet potato and black bean burritos, and Mediterranean puff pastry tart

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Michael Mosley runs an experiment to test whether beetroot and leafy greens can give your body and brain a boost, and Dr Zoe Williams investigates the new generation flu vaccine. Elsewhere in the programme, Surgeon Gabriel Weston discovers a new treatment that promises to improve the mobility of stroke survivors

programme.title: Generation Gifted
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following children from low income families over three critical years, exploring the challenges they face as they progress from ages 13 to 16. The first episode follows three young girls as they face the mounting pressure of their first year of GCSE preparation. In Port Talbot, avid reader Anne-Marie knows she wants to go to university, but needs help dealing with the prospect of exams. Meanwhile in Tamworth, Shakira's school try to help her find her creative voice by pushing her out of her comfort zone, and aspiring paediatrician Jada from Birmingham is determined to ace her Year 9 exams, as she hopes to secure her place at a nearby Sixth Form grammar school

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones and Nish Kumar join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Flatpack Empire
programme.desc: One of IKEA's newest designers, Hanna-Kaarina Heikkila, wants to challenge mass production by creating an `imperfect vase' that has the finger-marks of its creator. She travels to China to see if her idea is possible. There's also a visit to the home of the Billy Bookcase to see what it takes to be a supplier for IKEA, as the company tries to pitch a new range of wardrobes

programme.title: House of Saud: A Family at War
programme.desc: Examining how Saudi Arabia's most revered family stays in power, featuring interviews with those who have worked for Saudi princes. They describe how the wealth allowed lives of privilege and pleasure out of the spotlight. But the growth of social media has meant Saudis are getting increasing insight into the behaviour of their rulers, including their transgressions. Last in the series

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The final episode of the documentary about life in the surgical unit at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham follows medical staff and patients venturing into uncharted territory with clinical trials. Surgeons Richard Laing and Thamara Perera are part of a team attempting a new kind of liver transplant, while there are also pioneering treatments for prostate cancer and profound hearing loss. Last in the series

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: The bikers ride across the Balearic islands Menorca and Majorca, sampling great produce and finding out about the British influence in the Mediterranean from the 17th century to the present day. They reveal how mayonnaise was invented in Menorca's capital of Mahon, sample Menorcan gin, and meet British chef Mark Fosh, who has lived in Majorca for more than 20 years. Recipes include cuttlefish stew and squid salad with mayonnaise, fish and chips in gin and tonic batter, and sea bass a la mallorquina and saffron potato puree

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Chris Bavin investigates reports on the amount of pesticides found in honey, and Gloria Hunniford examines claims surrounding the true health benefits of 'free-from' foods

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At the Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from Loch Gairloch to Loch Maree, along the way meeting the `king and queen' of Islonia, matching a medieval feat of archery, diving to a wartime wreck in Loch Ewe and finding himself short-changed at a money tree

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day six of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including curling, cross-country skiing and ice hockey. Led by Kyle Smith, Great Britain continue their men's curling campaign with a pool match against Japan at Gangneung Curling Centre

programme.title: Animal Park Easter Special
programme.desc: A specialist wildlife cameraman from the BBCs Planet Earth series arrives at the park attempting to film Longleat's most impressive feeders. His subject is Bulls-eye, a chameleon who has a tongue that flies out four times faster than a jet fighter, but what if Bulls-eye doesn't want breakfast? Meanwhile, presenters Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover the lengths keepers go to for the animal orphans, while Jean Johansson sets up a tug of war for the lion pride. Elsewhere, the stakes couldn't be higher as vital testing for a killer disease continues, but when tragedy strikes, can the keepers recover from the unthinkable?(c)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts are joined by former footballer Dion Dublin to explore properties about to be auctioned. They visit a rundown cottage in Probus, Cornwall, a flat in Mitcham, south London, and a house in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire. They then speak to the buyers about their plans, and find out how much they paid for them at auction

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Nazeem Mungur believes emigrating to the warmer climate of the Southern Hemisphere would improve his health, so he and his family head to Australia's Gold Coast for a week's trial

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: In Hatfield, Hertfordshire, a researcher struggles to find any clues from neighbours about a retired factory worker whose father survived a First World War PoW camp

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and Philip Serrell advise two teams scouring Wetherby Racecourse for bargains. Anne Wickes from Wetherby's Second World War Experience Centre meets presenter Charlie Ross to show him some fascinating diaries that belonged to local war correspondent Godfrey Talbot

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present continued coverage of the latest events on day six of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including ice hockey, luge, figure skating and alpine skiing. The men's ice hockey competition continues with preliminary round fixtures at Gangneung Hockey Centre, and the luge team relay also takes place, with Germany looking to defend their title at the Olympic Sliding Centre. Plus, a round up of the day's earlier action, including the conclusion of the pairs' figure skating and the men's alpine skiing super-G

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his tour of Los Angeles, joining the locals for Mexican Independence Day, and discovering the secrets of backyard oil drilling in a county that is home to the largest urban oil field in the US. Moving on to Laguna Beach, he learns how artists from the east coast travelled west on the Transcontinental Railroad to found a colony of painters attracted by the beautiful coastline and glorious light to paint outside

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the sixth day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. Medals were decided in the men's alpine skiing super-G, pairs' figure skating and men's snowboard cross. Plus, Great Britain's men's and women's curling teams continued their bids for glory in the round-robin stages

programme.title: Sea City - Sunderland
programme.desc: New series. Documentary series going behind the scenes at various ports around the United Kingdom, beginning with Sunderland. The shipbuilding and coal exports that brought Sunderland's original wealth have disappeared - and now the city is looking to a new future, one that might see it hailed as the UK's answer to Silicon Valley. This film meets some of the people helping to bring about change, and others working to keep traditions alive, and witnesses as a new landmark arrives in the city to serve as a centrepiece for the Northern Spire Bridge. Narrated by Rob Bell(c)

programme.title: Generation Gifted
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries about children from low income families meets three bright 13-year-old boys facing many uncertainties. Kian from Hartlepool is a bright mathematician but worries about the future and feels pressure both at home and at school. Liam from Newcastle is on track to gain top science grades at GCSE but his teachers believe he is limiting his aspirations, while in London, problems at home threaten to derail talented student Jamarley. The producers will return to catch up with the children in two years' time. Narrated by Maxine Peake

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with comedy correspondents Ellie Taylor, Steve N Allen and Rachel Parris keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Jenny Campbell, Peter Jones, Touker Suleyman, Deborah Meaden and Tej Lalvani assess the profit-making potential of a young entrepreneur's plan for selling advertising space on the move, a teacher's unusual scheme for improving children's handwriting, and a range of chain-tensioning products for motorcycles

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford asks how much water a person needs to drink every day and Chris Bavins find out about gut bacteria. Plus, do certain foods really boost brain power?

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals - The Finals
programme.desc: The four remaining chefs fight to secure their place amongst the final three, with one contestant leaving the competition after a cook-off in the Masterchef kitchen. Then, the three remaining chefs are sent to the south of France to work in the 2 Michelin starred kitchens of the fourth best restaurant in the world; Mirazur, with Argentinian chef Mauro Colegreco

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Joining the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day seven of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including cross-country skiing, curling and ice hockey. Great Britain's Andrew Musgrave will hope to be in contention for a medal in the gruelling 15km cross-country skiing event at Alpensia Cross-Country Skiing Centre. Plus, round-robin matches take place in the women's curling and men's ice hockey

programme.title: Animal Park Easter Special
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle continue the story of the two endangered cheetah cubs, Poppy and Winston. Having survived the first few months it's time for them to go out into their big open enclosure, but it's next door to the lions and will soon be full of visitor's cars. But who is more nervous - their mum Wilma or the keepers? Jean Johansson meets a highly endangered secretary bird and a troop of incredibly cheeky monkeys, while a fruit bat is rushed to the vet with a suspected broken wing(c)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Former Manchester United footballer Dion Dublin joins Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts to examine a series of properties, including a three-bedroom semi in Plaistow, London, a small piece of land in Crayford, Kent, and a small house with a large garden in Wheelock, Cheshire

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Doctors Jo and Angus Goodson trial a week living in Tauranga, to test out Jo's hunch that a life in New Zealand will serve them better. Presented by Nicki Chapman

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A team uncovers a family hero who flew Wellington bombers during the Second World War, while in London an heir discovers more about her family's trade in glass blowing

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and Philip Serrell advise two teams scouring Wetherby Racecourse for bargains. Before heading over to the auction in Darlington, presenter Charlie Ross stops off to find out about the fascinating history of Yorkshire regiment the Green Howards

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present continued coverage of the latest events on day seven of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including skeleton, curling, and ice hockey. The women's skeleton heats continue, with Great Britain's Lizzy Yarnold the defending champion, and more curling and ice hockey matches also take place. Plus, a round-up of earlier events, including the men's figure skating short program and the women's snowboard cross final

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo nears the end of his 1,000-mile rail journey from Reno, Nevada, to San Diego in southern California. In this final leg, he joins the US Navy Pacific Fleet, birthplace of the elite flying academy Top Gun. Aboard the Pacific Surfliner, he arrives first in the coastal town of La Jolla, where he takes to the water in a kayak to explore the 75 million-year-old caves. In San Diego, he picks up the trail of the industrialist John D Spreckels, who built a pavilion to house the largest outdoor pipe organ in the world - which Michael is invited to play. Last in the series

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the seventh day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. Great Britain's Lizzy Yarnold began her bid to retain the skeleton title, and her compatriot Andrew Musgrave was aiming for a medal in the 15km cross-country. Plus, the finals of the women's aerials and men's skeleton

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the second semi-final of the celebrated quiz, inviting previously successful contenders to revisit the infamous black chair. The specialist subjects are the films of Paul Thomas Anderson, the novels of Virginia Woolf, the wines of Burgundy, rock band Motley Crue and writer Kazuo Ishiguro. As usual, the second round comprises general knowledge questions

programme.title: A Vicar's Life
programme.desc: The festive season is the busiest time for clergy in Hereford Diocese, but while there are special services to prepare there is also important ongoing pastoral work to be done in a bid to reach out to the wider community. Vicar Ruth Hulse visits a local training centre for young people who have struggled in mainstream education. In Shropshire, Matthew Stafford lends his support to a local farm, run by a member of his choir, that helps young people with special needs. In the Black Mountains, vicar Nicholas Lowton prepares for his carol service. Narrated by Jan Ravens. Last in the series

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Middle East
programme.desc: The writer visits Iran, starting in its bustling capital Tehran, where despite the boom in fast food outlets the dishes of the past still have a place in the hearts and culture of the people. Nigel is taken to lunch at his taxi driver's house to sample a popular stew known as dizi, then ventures north to the shores of the Caspian Sea to meet those who once fished for the famous beluga caviar, but now have to find other livings since sturgeon stocks have declined. Nigel explores the varied landscape, and harvests pomegranates and saffron, two items that epitomise Middle Eastern cuisine. Last in the series

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme `Overseas'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: Crime thriller starring Oscar Isaac and Jessica Chastain. New York City, 1981: upright entrepreneur Abel Morales is about to propel his heating oil business into the big time by buying a stretch of Brooklyn waterfront. However, his plans start to crumble as he comes under pressure from a crusading DA, ruthless local competitors and the demands of his Mob princess wife

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Bitcoin Millionaire? - Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines(c)

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan and a team of scientists learn more about various species through the use of animal bodycams. In Namibia, they help conservationist Marlice van Vuuren find out whether the three orphaned cheetahs she has raised have developed the skills needed to hunt for themselves in the wild, with close-up footage revealing how the cats choose their prey. On Kanowna Island off the south coast of Australia, Gordon discovers how the fur seal population manages to thrive and hunt in the surrounding shark-infested waters, and in South Africa, cameras gives an insight into the lives of wild baboons

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford learns how diet can help combat the painful symptoms of arthritis, while Chris Bavin investigates claims about food's powers for mental health. Last in the series

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals: The Finals
programme.desc: The search for a chef to be crowned MasterChef: Professionals champion 2017 is almost over, as the three finalists face one last challenge. They are given three hours to cook a starter, a main course and a dessert, each of which takes their culinary abilities to a whole new level, with flawless presentation and exciting flavours. Judges Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace assess their efforts, before deciding the winner

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Joining the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes curling and ice hockey. The men's British curling team will be in action this morning as they take on South Korea in their latest round-robin encounter at Gangneung Curling Centre, which reaches the halfway stage today. Meanwhile, the women's ice hockey competition has reached the quarter-final stage, and matches are scheduled to take place at Kwandong Hockey Centre

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Donal Skehan invites actor Stephen Mangan to join him in the studio, where he samples dishes prepared by Ching-He Huang and Ken Hom

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Everyday ingredients transformed, including bananas used as the basis of a sophisticated tarte-tatin and light Italian dumplings with simple ricotta cheese

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further coverage of the latest events on day eight of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. The short track speed skating continues at Gangneung Ice Arena, which today is scheduled to stage the finals of the women's 1500m and men's 1,000m

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is hoping to find a rural home in Dorset for a couple from London who have a healthy budget of £875,000. While in the countryside, the presenter tries her hand at traditional green woodworking

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Chris van Tulleken aims to sort fact from fiction as he investigates whether garlic, watermelon and beetroot really deserve the reputation they have gained as `superfoods'. Michael Mosley also visits leading nutrition experts to find out whether sugar is really as toxic as tobacco, as had been suggested by recent studies. Plus, Dr Saleyha Ahsan explodes some of the myths surrounding the best way to treat burns

programme.title: The Third Man
programme.desc: Classic thriller written by Graham Greene, starring Joseph Cotten and Orson Welles and featuring Alida Valli. Holly Martins, a writer of western stories, arrives in Vienna after the end of the Second World War where he has been promised work by his old friend, Harry Lime. However, on his arrival, Martins is told that Lime is dead and was involved in racketeering. Martins resolves to clear his friend's name but his investigations uncover some disturbing truths

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the 19th-century, Gothic mansion Highcliffe Castle in Dorset. Antique expert Christina Trevanion is joined by Adam Partridge to look at several fascinating collections, including Isle of Wight glass and postcards by 20th-century manufacturer Tucks. Plus, Paul explores the extraordinary story of a wheeler dealer Victorian collector in nearby Bournemouth

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Middle East
programme.desc: Turkey is one of only a handful of nations that has the ability to be self-sufficient. Its hugely diverse landscape produces a spectacular range and quantity of produce that defines its local cuisine. In its capital, Istanbul, Nigel gets a taste of the exuberant dishes of the Sultans, before travelling to Central Anatolia where he meets families who are working hard to preserve their traditional food culture in the face of mounting modernity. The food writer also explores the Eastern Black Sea region, where he discovers the truly mosaic-like quality of Turkish culture and cuisine

programme.title: Tom Kerridge: Lose Weight for Good
programme.desc: With some of the dieters finding it hard to resist high calorie lunch options when they are at work, Tom creates recipes to help them resist temptation away from home. The chef demonstrates how to make a low-calorie popcorn and chocolate snack bar with marshmallow, sweet potato and black bean burritos, and Mediterranean puff pastry tart

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Dartmoor serves as the next destination of choice for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, as his trek across the West Country continues. Here, he follows the fortunes of a buzzard family as their sole chick fledges and makes its first moves toward independence. He also tracks salmon as they migrate upstream to breed, and helps marine biologists to survey dolphins off the Devon coast. Plus, efforts to bring water voles back to the region following a 30-year absence, and the work of a local vet who has built up an extraordinary level of trust with an otter family living at the bottom of his garden

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the eighth day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. Great Britain's Lizzy Yarnold will have hoped to claim a second consecutive skeleton title, while Elise Christie will have been hoping to be in contention for a medal in the women's 1500m short track speed skating. Meanwhile, both the women's and men's Great Britain curling teams were in action against their South Korean counterparts, while gold medals were awarded in alpine skiing, biathlon, cross-country skiing, figure skating, freestyle skiing and ski jumping events

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: New series. The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdom's bizarre hybrids, including the `pizzly bear', a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America. Previously seen on W

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring is elated to find a German pilot trapped on top of the town clock by his parachute - but first the platoon has to get him down. David Croft and Jimmy Perry's classic comedy, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme `Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct

programme.title: Imagine - Mel Brooks: Unwrapped
programme.desc: Alan Yentob travels to Hollywood to interview Mel Brooks, the comedy actor, writer, producer and director who turned 91 last year. At the time of filming, the musical theatre version of Brooks' 1974 comedy horror Young Frankenstein had just opened on London's West End. Yentob marks the occasion by profiling its creator, observing him at work and play, and revisiting archive interviews stretching back decades(c)

programme.title: Young Frankenstein
programme.desc: Horror spoof starring Gene Wilder and Peter Boyle. Though shamed by his infamous ancestry, medical-school teacher Frederick Frankenstein goes to Transylvania to receive a family legacy, and it is in that mysterious, far-off land that he dreams of reanimating the dead

programme.desc: Summer's school work suffers as she tries to cope with the household chores, and Craig arrives with Valentine's roses for Bethany. Meanwhile, Liz is shocked when she discovers who Ali, the new GP trainee at the practice really is

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Family

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen and Eva are shocked to find a comatose Billy in the flat, and Bethany tells Sarah she has arranged for her to go on a date with Aidan. And during the Race for your Wife charity run, Robert drops to one knee and proposes to Michelle

programme.title: Trauma
programme.desc: In the final episode, believing he has failed his son, Dan goes to extreme lengths to get Jon to tell him what really happened when Alex died. Faced with losing his family and professional reputation, Jon is confronted with a man so enraged about the injustice of being silenced, that he may not stop until he has extracted the ultimate revenge. programme.desc: Action from the first batch of last-16 first-leg encounters, featuring FC Basel v Manchester City at St Jakob-Park, Juventus v Tottenham Hotspur at the Allianz Stadium, FC Porto v Liverpool at the Estadio do Dragao and Real Madrid v Paris Saint-Germain at the Bernabeu. Narrated by Jamie Theakston(c)

programme.title: Plastic: Can You Live Without It? Tonight
programme.desc: Plastic waste is polluting the oceans and there are concerns it is now even in the food chain. The UK government has announced a plan to crack down on it and improve the environment, but that will take 25 years. Helen Skelton investigates whether anything could - and should - be done much quicker, and what people can do to rethink their reliance on plastic(c)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is on edge, Tracy is sheepish, and Robert is hopeful

programme.title: The Cruise: Return to the Mediterranean
programme.desc: As the summer season draws to a close, the captain and crew of the Royal Princess face one final challenge - two weddings on one day. Passenger services manager Ina has the job of coordinating the task, from the galley team making two cakes, a buffet and a gourmet meal, to ship's florist Jess, who has eight bouquets to make in a tight timeframe. Before he officiates at the ceremonies, Captain Nick Nash has a tricky manoeuvre to make into the Spanish port of Cartagena, while a problem with the fountain display is proving a mystery for the engineers. Last in the series

programme.title: Children Who Kill
programme.desc: Juveniles found guilty of murder in the US are given life, with no chance of parole - a hardline approach that in 2015 prompted the American Supreme Court to rule such sentences as `unconstitutional'. With the system now under review, Susanna Reid travels to the US and talks to young killers about their crimes and life in jail - including one speaking for the first time since discovering he have the right to have his sentence reviewed. Susanna also meets the families of victims, to ask how they feel about a possible change to American's approach to juvenile sentencing

programme.title: UEFA Europa League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the last-32 first legs in European football's second club competition. programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team are in London, where they transform the run-down garden of Joan Myers, a senior paediatric nurse who has worked tirelessly to help improve the way children are cared for within the NHS - but in doing so, has let her own garden become overgrown. Alan plans to give her a peaceful retreat outside her back door with flavours of Africa and the Caribbean, as well as more than a splash of purple, her favourite colour. He also reflects Joan's community spirit by challenging the team to make over three front gardens, finding different ways of revitalising these tired and forgotten spaces

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bethany is convinced Craig stood her up because of the way she treated him. Elsewhere, Michelle tries to talk to Ali about his placement and why he hasn't been in touch, and Carla tells Sinead that Daniel is still in love with her

programme.desc: Now in full swing, this second series of the action drama finds Roger Murtaugh attempting to steer clear of the type of demons haunting his partner Martin Riggs, while negotiating some challenging times in his personal life. In this instalment, Riggs is reunited with childhood friends, but comes to realise they might be mixed up in the robbery-homicide case he and Murtaugh are investigating. Meanwhile, Murtaugh finds a joint stashed in his kitchen that he brings to Scorsese for testing in an effort to bust one of his children. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star

programme.title: The Hungry Sailors
programme.desc: Dick and James Strawbridge continue their journey along the south-west coast of England as they visit Cremyll in south-east Cornwall, where they help a woman move an enormous pig ark. Heading inland, the duo meet a cordial-maker who gets all her ingredients from the hedgerow, and are shown how to forage and make their own blend. They then return to the Morwenna to make dinner for their guests and anticipate their next stop, the Channel Islands

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Love Week arrives at the rink, just in time for St Valentine's Day. Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Jason Gardiner and Ashley Banjo once more take their places on the judging panel, as Holly Willoughby and Philip Schofield welcome the eight remaining celebrities and their pro-skater partners back out onto the ice. After passing the halfway point of the contest last week, the would-be champions will be facing ever-increasing levels of scrutint from the judges, meaning that each of them will have to work harder than ever to avoid the prospect of a Skate Off

Days before he is due to retire, detective Roger Murtaugh, along with his partner Martin Riggs, is demoted after an attempt to defuse a bomb results in the destruction of an office building. But the maverick cops' return to the beat is short-lived, and they are soon back in plain clothes and in hot pursuit of a former cop now involved in gun running

Before he officiates at the ceremonies, Captain Nick Nash has a tricky manoeuvre to make into the Spanish port of Cartagena, while a problem with the fountain display is proving a mystery for the engineers. programme.desc: Juveniles found guilty of murder in the US are given life, with no chance of parole - a hardline approach that in 2015 prompted the American Supreme Court to rule such sentences as `unconstitutional'. With the system now under review, Susanna Reid travels to the US and talks to young killers about their crimes and life in jail - including one speaking for the first time since discovering he have the right to have his sentence reviewed. Susanna also meets the families of victims, to ask how they feel about a possible change to American's approach to juvenile sentencing

Will he be able to warn her before it's too late? Fact-based drama, starring Reece Shearsmith, John Hannah and Archie Panjabi. Last in the series

programme.desc: Maggie has no choice but to charge her prime suspect when he reveals information only the killer could have known, but she's not convinced he is the culprit. Meanwhile, Claire and Daniel's marriage is pushed to breaking point by the return of their neighbour Teresa, and the reappearance of an old face leaves Luke shaken. Crime drama set across two timelines, starring Tamsin Greig, Katherine Kelly and Darren Boyd. Last in the series

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Another chance to see John Thaw's farewell appearance as Colin Dexter's Oxford detective. Back from sick leave, Morse uncovers new evidence concerning the year-long investigation into the murder of Yvonne Harrison, but has to cope with playing second fiddle to long-standing sidekick Lewis - and there are questions about whether he is fit enough to handle the case. Kevin Whately co-stars, with James Grout, Jesse Birdsall, Clare Holman and Paul Freeman

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: On the penultimate leg of his voyage exploring some of Britain's best waterways, the broadcaster heads into Birmingham, a city with more canals than Venice. Along the way, he delves into the history of Cadbury in Bournville, enjoys a refreshing pint, finds out why Birmingham is the nation's curry capital - and tries to buy a gun

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The green-fingered team returns with more surprise garden makeovers for deserving people across the nation. Darren and Lesley Chan's youngest daughter Amelie was born with Charge syndrome - a debilitating genetic condition that has left her deaf, partially sighted and in need of constant care. Alan Titchmarsh sets out to transform the Manchester family's neglected outdoor space, calling in David Domoney, Frances Tophill and Katie Rushworth to introduce sensory planting for the 10-year-old, a shade-loving border and a multifunction pathway made from areas of decking, artificial turf and paving

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital has its hands full when a typhoid epidemic breaks out in the community. programme.title: Joe Maddison's War
programme.desc: It is 1939, and Newcastle shipyard worker Joe Maddison feels past his prime - too old to serve in the war alongside his son, who is beginning his RAF training. A few days later, when his wife leaves him for a young naval officer, Joe finds himself without purpose and in need of a new challenge - so he and best friend Harry decide to join the Home Guard. The decision is one that leads him on a journey of self-discovery and teaches him lessons in heroism, friendship and love. Feature-length drama written by Alan Plater, starring Kevin Whately, Robson Green, Derek Jacobi, Melanie Hill, Trevor Fox and John Woodvine

programme.title: Morecambe and Wise Forever
programme.desc: Part one of two. Celebrating the life and work of the double act, with Eric's children Gary and Gail taking a nostalgic tour of their father's birthplace

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster returns to travel more of Britain's canal network, exploring the extraordinary stories of the people and places on the way. The series starts with John navigating the Peak Forest Canal, which runs through stunning countryside from Buxworth in Derbyshire to Ashton-under-Lyne. Along the way, in Hyde he meets former boxer Ricky Hatton, who discusses his plans to revitalise the area and offer new opportunities to local youngsters, and joins a team of junior archaeologists at Mellor Mill, who are attempting to unearth the remains of what was once one of the world's largest mills

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster leaves central Manchester, heading east along the Rochdale Canal. Not long into his journey, John finds himself struggling to contend with 19th-century technology at a cotton works. Further up the canal, he helps out members of an conservation group clearing the waterway of dumped supermarket trollies. After passing into West Yorkshire, it's on to Hebden Bridge, famous for the hard-wearing material corduroy, before John tries his hand at clog-making in one of Britain's few remaining factories dedicated to the craft

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh comes to the aid of a couple who founded a charity to support bereaved families after the loss of their 23-month-old son. Claire and Ian Estick have a busy schedule fundraising and running their organisation, meaning their large L-shaped garden has become a confused mix of children's play equipment, a neglected greenhouse and overgrown shrubs and trees. Alan and the team set about transforming it into four distinct spaces, featuring a kitchen garden and a tranquil seating area, and show viewers how to tackle a towering leylandii hedge

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Frankie accidentally injures a man attempting to steal his motorbike, but is stricken with guilt when the thief dies after crashing the vehicle. A woman being treated for severe burns disappears home, where Drs Ormerod and Weatherill discover her family secret, while Alun becomes obsessed by an expensive stereo system. With Scott Taylor, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Merton is suspended following allegations of theft made by a woman he was dating, but Mike believes he is innocent and sets about clearing his name. Meanwhile, Vernon becomes concerned about Bernie's strange behaviour. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Jason Durr, Jan Francis and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack is offered the job of bus inspector and Stan is promised extra overtime, for which he will not have to work - as well as a glamorous conductress. Reg Varney and Bob Grant star

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Beryl describes her ideal man, leaving Arthur dejected because he does not even begin to measure up. Reg Varney stars

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: There is a hole in the church roof, so Flora decides to raise the money by putting on a show. Comedy set in a residential home, starring Peggy Mount and Pat Coombs

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Jeffrey and George get into the festive spirit by challenging each other to a game of computer tennis. Festive instalment of the comedy, from 1978, starring Brian Murphy and Norman Eshley

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: An unscrupulous landlord is killed, and suspicion falls on an impoverished factory worker whose life he made hell. However, Jessica Fletcher is not convinced of the woman's guilt and sets out to unmask the real killer. Guest starring Lorna Luft, alongside Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oswald Cooper is the prime suspect in the rape of a teenage girl, but presents an alibi supported by three pillars of the community. When Cooper is murdered, Lewis discovers a web of deceit going back 20 years, in which the dead man was used by the trio to cover up a sordid series of secrets - but the case soon takes on a personal dimension for the inspector. Kwame Kwei-Armah, Sean McGinley, Richard McCabe and Daniela Nardini guest star, with Kevin Whately

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Ruby gets to grips with her challenging new routine working at the under-resourced and overworked hospital, but tension mounts when she begins to question Gabriel's professional conduct. The doctors have a troubling mystery on their hands when an unidentified man is discovered washed up on the beach, and also face a race against the clock to find a local snake catcher whose luck may have run out, leaving him in urgent need of treatment. Medical drama set in India, starring Amrita Acharia and Amanda Redman

programme.title: An Hour To Catch a Killer with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Ground-breaking documentary with unprecedented access to Northumbria murder detectives as they set out to solve the killing of a 24-year-old woman from Gateshead. From the moment the body is discovered by the victim's flatmate, body-cameras worn by the officers allow viewers to see how the investigation unfolds throughout the crucial first hour. Presented by Trevor McDonald

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated mystery thriller based on actual events in 1920s California, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Angelina Jolie. A single mother is relieved to hear that her kidnapped son is being returned to her. But when he arrives at the local railway station, she soon realises that the police have brought her the wrong child

programme.title: The Railway Children
programme.desc: Classic period drama based on the novel by E Nesbit, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett and Gary Warren. When a government official is arrested on suspicion of treason, his wife and three children are forced to leave their London home and move to a small cottage in Yorkshire. While their mother fights for her husband's release, the children have marvellous adventures

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper wants to install a shower, but a lack of cash forces a compromise on costs - and workmanship. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: George and Mildred
