programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica meets an old friend who happens to be one of the best homicide detectives in Los Angeles, and helps provide the vital clue in the case that ended his career. Starring Angela Lansbury and Barry Newman

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A woman disrupts Cabot Cove's mayoral election campaign by claiming one of the candidates is her secret husband and the father of her five children. Jessica steps in to investigate when she is found dead. Ruth Roman guest stars

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A casino is robbed, presenting Frost with a fresh challenge to his deductive powers, and things go from bad to worse when a local copper is reported missing and a well-known armed thug is spotted in Denton. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and George Anton

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: First in a two-part tribute to the comedy magician, revealing how an act that started out in the desert during the Second World War went on to take the entertainment world by storm

programme.title: Tommy Cooper Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Singer and actress Anita Harris retraces her footsteps back to the London Palladium where she worked with Tommy. Comedian Les Dennis makes an emotional trip back to Her Majesty's Theatre to remember the night he saw Tommy's final performance. Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s

programme.title: Columbo: the Most Crucial Game
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oswald Cooper is the prime suspect in the rape of a teenage girl, but presents an alibi supported by three pillars of the community. When Cooper is murdered, Lewis discovers a web of deceit going back 20 years, in which the dead man was used by the trio to cover up a sordid series of secrets - but the case soon takes on a personal dimension for the inspector. Kwame Kwei-Armah, Sean McGinley, Richard McCabe and Daniela Nardini guest star, with Kevin Whately

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual harvest fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death arrive in the Midsomer village of Whitcombe Mallet. But when the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson, along with the expertise of forensic pathologist Kam Karimore, must unravel a complex feud from the past. However, nothing is as it seems, and they are in a race against time as they work to solve the case. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk and Fiona Dolman

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Margo takes great pride in her new job at the surgery, but after a chance encounter with a recluse, she begins to realise where her greatest talent lies. Louisa grows closer to Sven, but as Gerry befriends a convict and Leslie begins spending all his time in the local bars, she begins to suspect she has made a mistake bringing her children to Corfu

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Leslie falls in with a bad crowd and ends up being falsely accused of armed robbery, prompting Louisa to take desperate measures to save him. Margo takes a shine to a gardener at the Villa Mavrodaki, Captain Creech returns, and the family realises the extent of Gerry's passion for animals when he turns his bedroom into a centre for scientific learning. Guest starring Leslie Caron

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oswald Cooper is the prime suspect in the rape of a teenage girl, but presents an alibi supported by three pillars of the community. Kwame Kwei-Armah, Sean McGinley, Richard McCabe and Daniela Nardini guest star, with Kevin Whately

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Old wounds are reopened when Maggie interviews Callum's parents and their neighbours, who find themselves under suspicion once again. Daniel is brought in for questioning, but the secret the detective uncovers is not what she was expecting. Meanwhile, a trip to Germany puts a key witness statement in a disturbing light and Claire makes a shocking discovery closer to home. Crime drama set across two timelines, starring Tamsin Greig, Katherine Kelly and Darren Boyd

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The Oxford detective is given a book on Victorian crimes while languishing in hospital, and soon becomes obsessed with a murder committed in 1859. Convinced the three men hanged for the crime were innocent, he sets out to solve the long-forgotten case. Starring John Thaw, Lisa Eichhorn, Judy Loe, Matthew Finney, James Grout and Clare Holman

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the horticultural experts come to the aid of Vicky and Simon Pyne, whose daughter Alice died of cancer in January 2013. Alice's story was reported around the world after she created an online list of things she wanted to do or achieve in her final years, while raising thousands of pounds for charity. The team plans to bring the best of the Cumbrian landscape to the Pynes' awkwardly shaped garden, complete with a refuge for their 14-year-old daughter Milly, who has faced her own health problems over the years

programme.desc: Rigsby's divorce finally comes through, and he wastes no time in proposing to Miss Jones - but makes the mistake of asking his low-life brother Ron to be best man. Final episode of Eric Chappell's classic comedy, which finally reveals Rigsby's Christian name. Leonard Rossiter stars

programme.desc: The Ropers babysit for their neighbours, but George misses his usual routine - so he nips out to a darts match with the infant in tow. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy

programme.title: The Widower
programme.desc: DS Henry raids Malcolm's home after hearing he's embezzling funds at an angling club, and finds stolen laptops as well as an unlicensed firearm - but legal technicalities result in the case being dropped. The detective then discovers Malcolm and Simone are planning a transatlantic trip and fears the killer could use this opportunity to murder his fiancee. Will he be able to warn her before it's too late? Fact-based drama, starring Reece Shearsmith, John Hannah and Archie Panjabi. Last in the series

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Maggie has no choice but to charge her prime suspect when he reveals information only the killer could have known, but she's not convinced he is the culprit. Meanwhile, Claire and Daniel's marriage is pushed to breaking point by the return of their neighbour Teresa, and the reappearance of an old face leaves Luke shaken. Crime drama set across two timelines, starring Tamsin Greig, Katherine Kelly and Darren Boyd. Last in the series

Alan Titchmarsh sets out to transform the Manchester family's neglected outdoor space, calling in David Domoney, Frances Tophill and Katie Rushworth to introduce sensory planting for the 10-year-old, a shade-loving border and a multifunction pathway made from areas of decking, artificial turf and paving

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital has its hands full when a typhoid epidemic breaks out in the community. Things get worse as the disease's source is traced back to the wards and staff struggle to locate it. Dr Weatherill is forced to reprimand Dr Ormerod after catching him sleeping on the job - but also has startling news for him. Drama, starring Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.desc: Nicholson delays his 21st-birthday celebrations to join Bellamy in pursuit of two armed and dangerous criminals, but takes one risk too many. programme.title: Joe Maddison's War
programme.desc: It is 1939, and Newcastle shipyard worker Joe Maddison feels past his prime - too old to serve in the war alongside his son, who is beginning his RAF training. A few days later, when his wife leaves him for a young naval officer, Joe finds himself without purpose and in need of a new challenge - so he and best friend Harry decide to join the Home Guard. The decision is one that leads him on a journey of self-discovery and teaches him lessons in heroism, friendship and love. Feature-length drama written by Alan Plater, starring Kevin Whately, Robson Green, Derek Jacobi, Melanie Hill, Trevor Fox and John Woodvine

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster returns to travel more of Britain's canal network, exploring the extraordinary stories of the people and places on the way. The series starts with John navigating the Peak Forest Canal, which runs through stunning countryside from Buxworth in Derbyshire to Ashton-under-Lyne. Along the way, in Hyde he meets former boxer Ricky Hatton, who discusses his plans to revitalise the area and offer new opportunities to local youngsters, and joins a team of junior archaeologists at Mellor Mill, who are attempting to unearth the remains of what was once one of the world's largest mills

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster leaves central Manchester, heading east along the Rochdale Canal. Not long into his journey, John finds himself struggling to contend with 19th-century technology at a cotton works. Further up the canal, he helps out members of an conservation group clearing the waterway of dumped supermarket trollies. After passing into West Yorkshire, it's on to Hebden Bridge, famous for the hard-wearing material corduroy, before John tries his hand at clog-making in one of Britain's few remaining factories dedicated to the craft

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh comes to the aid of a couple who founded a charity to support bereaved families after the loss of their 23-month-old son. Claire and Ian Estick have a busy schedule fundraising and running their organisation, meaning their large L-shaped garden has become a confused mix of children's play equipment, a neglected greenhouse and overgrown shrubs and trees. Alan and the team set about transforming it into four distinct spaces, featuring a kitchen garden and a tranquil seating area, and show viewers how to tackle a towering leylandii hedge

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Frankie accidentally injures a man attempting to steal his motorbike, but is stricken with guilt when the thief dies after crashing the vehicle. A woman being treated for severe burns disappears home, where Drs Ormerod and Weatherill discover her family secret, while Alun becomes obsessed by an expensive stereo system. With Scott Taylor, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: An unscrupulous landlord is killed, and suspicion falls on an impoverished factory worker whose life he made hell. However, Jessica Fletcher is not convinced of the woman's guilt and sets out to unmask the real killer. Guest starring Lorna Luft, alongside Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oswald Cooper is the prime suspect in the rape of a teenage girl, but presents an alibi supported by three pillars of the community. When Cooper is murdered, Lewis discovers a web of deceit going back 20 years, in which the dead man was used by the trio to cover up a sordid series of secrets - but the case soon takes on a personal dimension for the inspector. Kwame Kwei-Armah, Sean McGinley, Richard McCabe and Daniela Nardini guest star, with Kevin Whately

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Ruby gets to grips with her challenging new routine working at the under-resourced and overworked hospital, but tension mounts when she begins to question Gabriel's professional conduct. The doctors have a troubling mystery on their hands when an unidentified man is discovered washed up on the beach, and also face a race against the clock to find a local snake catcher whose luck may have run out, leaving him in urgent need of treatment. Medical drama set in India, starring Amrita Acharia and Amanda Redman

programme.title: An Hour To Catch a Killer with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Ground-breaking documentary with unprecedented access to Northumbria murder detectives as they set out to solve the killing of a 24-year-old woman from Gateshead. From the moment the body is discovered by the victim's flatmate, body-cameras worn by the officers allow viewers to see how the investigation unfolds throughout the crucial first hour. Presented by Trevor McDonald

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated mystery thriller based on actual events in 1920s California, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Angelina Jolie. A single mother is relieved to hear that her kidnapped son is being returned to her. But when he arrives at the local railway station, she soon realises that the police have brought her the wrong child

programme.title: The Railway Children
programme.desc: Classic period drama based on the novel by E Nesbit, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett and Gary Warren. When a government official is arrested on suspicion of treason, his wife and three children are forced to leave their London home and move to a small cottage in Yorkshire. While their mother fights for her husband's release, the children have marvellous adventures

Plus, how Cooper became an unlikely comedy hero on Dutch TV in the 1960s

programme.title: Columbo: the Most Crucial Game
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual harvest fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death arrive in the Midsomer village of Whitcombe Mallet. But when the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson, along with the expertise of forensic pathologist Kam Karimore, must unravel a complex feud from the past. However, nothing is as it seems, and they are in a race against time as they work to solve the case. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Gwilym Lee, Manjinder Virk and Fiona Dolman

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Margo takes great pride in her new job at the surgery, but after a chance encounter with a recluse, she begins to realise where her greatest talent lies. Louisa grows closer to Sven, but as Gerry befriends a convict and Leslie begins spending all his time in the local bars, she begins to suspect she has made a mistake bringing her children to Corfu

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Leslie falls in with a bad crowd and ends up being falsely accused of armed robbery, prompting Louisa to take desperate measures to save him. Margo takes a shine to a gardener at the Villa Mavrodaki, Captain Creech returns, and the family realises the extent of Gerry's passion for animals when he turns his bedroom into a centre for scientific learning. Guest starring Leslie Caron

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade takes on the biggest investigation of his career, hoping to unravel the exact fate of ocean liner RMS Laconia, which after being converted into an armed merchant cruiser was torpedoed by a German U-boat in the mid-Atlantic in September 1942. At the time of the attack the vessel was carrying a mixture of British soldiers, Polish soldiers, Italian prisoners of war and civilians, 1,500 of whom died. This investigation leads Jeremy to the largest fish he had ever caught, as well as the deepest place he had ever been. Last in the series

Crime drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Doyle is shot by an intruder in his flat, and enters a near coma. Cowley fears a terrorist group - two of whose members were blown up during a recent car chase by CI5 - is responsible. While Doyle experiences surreal dreams involving a ghostly graveyard, Cowley and Bodie attempt to pursue the villain behind the attack. Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: The Chief investigates a murder case in which a talkative mynah bird may hold the clues. Police drama, starring Raymond Burr

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: An evangelist's apparent suicide troubles Quincy, prompting him to break with established procedure and attempt a `psychological autopsy' in a bid to determine the truth. Drama, starring Jack Klugman and Robert Ito

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur and Terry fall under the spell of a bewitching Australian beauty who has ventured from Down Under in search of her missing fiance. However, she may just happen to be concealing an ulterior motive. George Cole and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A frustrated housewife supplies Regan with the names of the gang who recently ransacked a bookmakers - including that of her husband, a notorious robber. programme.title: The Professionals

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Hornblower
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama, which sees CS Forester's seafaring hero crossing swords with tyrannical Captain James Sawyer, an officer on the brink of madness. Reprimanded for falling asleep while on watch, young Horatio partly redeems himself by saving the Renown from seemingly certain disaster - but ends up charged with mutiny. Ioan Gruffudd, Robert Lindsay and David Warner star

programme.desc: Drama starring rap artist Eminem and Kim Basinger. Jimmy 'Rabbit' Smith is stuck in a dead-end factory job in a tough area of Detroit where he lives with his highly strung mother and little sister. Jimmy longs to break out of this bleak existence by making it as a rapper, but his road to stardom is going to be a rocky one

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade takes on the biggest investigation of his career, hoping to unravel the exact fate of ocean liner RMS Laconia, which after being converted into an armed merchant cruiser was torpedoed by a German U-boat in the mid-Atlantic in September 1942. At the time of the attack the vessel was carrying a mixture of British soldiers, Polish soldiers, Italian prisoners of war and civilians, 1,500 of whom died. This investigation leads Jeremy to the largest fish he had ever caught, as well as the deepest place he had ever been. Last in the series

programme.desc: Part two of two. The fact that Ian has taken a personal item of Trish's without her knowledge comes to light(n)

programme.title: Houdini & Doyle
programme.desc: When victims are found literally scared to death, the clues lead to Bedlam asylum, with which Doyle has a disturbing history - and when the writer starts to lose his grip on reality, he does not know if he is going mad or if he is the next victim(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: While Cade is away investigating charges against a deputy chief constable of another constabulary, questions of loyalty are raised on Cade's own patch as a large demonstration takes place at a nuclear plant. Martin Shaw stars(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew bites the bullet and tells Erica he wants them to be a couple, but her reaction is not as he had hoped when she tells him he is fickle. Meanwhile, Claire's extrovert behaviour causes gossip among the locals and concern for David(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Chief Constable Alan Cade hates firearms but after an armed robbery on a countryside mansion he is forced to carry a weapon for his own safety - with tragic consequences. Martin Shaw stars(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Terry is having a hard time coming to terms with Jay's death, blaming himself for the tragedy and brooding over his own future - and the threatening behaviour of a sick child's father proves the last straw. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jane Danson and Connor McIntyre(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: James discovers Sam has been stealing drugs, leading to a heated confrontation, and his day goes from bad to worse when tragic consequences result from his decision to operate on a patient despite not being qualified to carry out the procedure. Drummond makes it clear he expects Robert to hand in his resignation and Judy is in agonies of indecision over coming out as gay, but gets little sympathy from Ruth. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen, with a cameo appearance by TV presenter Judi Spiers as herself(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: The house in Riseholme is sold and Lucia decides to settle in Tilling(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Prince Louis of Battenburg is introduced to Lillie by the Prince of Wales, and soon becomes infatuated with her(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: As the day of his wedding finally arrives, Nick decides to avoid the hurly-burly of the police house by taking a soothing drive in the country - where he promptly gets involved in a domestic dispute and ends up stranded on the moors miles from anywhere(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is busy honeymooning with Jo and in his absence Aidensfield is transformed from a sleepy rural retreat into a scene of mayhem and violence. programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: With the suspects in the murder of David Walker all having either a motive, opportunity or connection to the victim, Cassie and Sunny are left with a massive puzzle to solve. Starring Phil Davis, Rupert Penry-Jones, and Steve Pemberton, who also wrote this episode(n)

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. programme.desc: When victims are found literally scared to death, the clues lead to Bedlam asylum, with which Doyle has a disturbing history - and when the writer starts to lose his grip on reality, he does not know if he is going mad or if he is the next victim(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: While Cade is away investigating charges against a deputy chief constable of another constabulary, questions of loyalty are raised on Cade's own patch as a large demonstration takes place at a nuclear plant. Martin Shaw stars(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew bites the bullet and tells Erica he wants them to be a couple, but her reaction is not as he had hoped when she tells him he is fickle. Meanwhile, Claire's extrovert behaviour causes gossip among the locals and concern for David(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Chief Constable Alan Cade hates firearms but after an armed robbery on a countryside mansion he is forced to carry a weapon for his own safety - with tragic consequences. Martin Shaw stars(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Terry is having a hard time coming to terms with Jay's death, blaming himself for the tragedy and brooding over his own future - and the threatening behaviour of a sick child's father proves the last straw. Judy feels awkward after discovering Ruth is a lesbian, and Sam has no end of problems - drug dealer Tim is piling on the pressure, James confesses he's married and a patient's mother asks her to cover up a guilty secret. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jane Danson and Connor McIntyre(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: James discovers Sam has been stealing drugs, leading to a heated confrontation, and his day goes from bad to worse when tragic consequences result from his decision to operate on a patient despite not being qualified to carry out the procedure. Drummond makes it clear he expects Robert to hand in his resignation and Judy is in agonies of indecision over coming out as gay, but gets little sympathy from Ruth. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen, with a cameo appearance by TV presenter Judi Spiers as herself(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: The house in Riseholme is sold and Lucia decides to settle in Tilling(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Prince Louis of Battenburg is introduced to Lillie by the Prince of Wales, and soon becomes infatuated with her(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: As the day of his wedding finally arrives, Nick decides to avoid the hurly-burly of the police house by taking a soothing drive in the country - where he promptly gets involved in a domestic dispute and ends up stranded on the moors miles from anywhere(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is busy honeymooning with Jo and in his absence Aidensfield is transformed from a sleepy rural retreat into a scene of mayhem and violence. A pair of armed robbers disguised as hippies take Greengrass hostage during a payroll heist and shoot his beloved dog. Despite the best efforts of new constable Mike Bradley, the villains make their getaway - and Blaketon's heroic intervention causes him to collapse with a heart attack(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Deightons, a family of crooked travellers, pitches camp in Aidensfield, and it is not long before its members are plotting to steal Greengrass's new horse and even kidnapping Ventress. With Nick still away on honeymoon, it is up to PCs Bellamy and Bradley to bring the rogues to justice. Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds star(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Madeleine reluctantly begins re-examining her attitude to the Germans and Renard is arrested for an act of resistance, forcing him into a battle of wills with the secret police. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: James confesses to the La Salles that he was responsible for Eugene's death and Sheldon discovers Zelda's hiding place in Cassie's shop, and urges her to flee the island. Philip is determined to get back to England and hatches an escape plan with the help of Wilf and James, but the day ends in disaster when the three men are arrested and sent to a prison in France. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery(n)

Crime drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies stars in a feature-length episode of the offbeat crime drama. Master of illusion Jonathan is called upon to solve several disappearances inside the gloomy attic of a vast Gothic house, but is completely baffled by the mystery, which for 70 years has been attributed to the ghost of a madman said to prey upon human flesh. When two women shelter from a thunderstorm there one night, the ominous presence claims another victim, leaving her friend - Joey Ross - determined to get to the truth of what happened. Jonathan finds himself working alongside Joey, and it seems his formidable powers of deduction are in danger of being eclipsed by her raw intuition. With Sheridan Smith as Joey(n)

programme.title: Rizzoli & Isles
programme.desc: Jane and Maura's day at an outdoor spa is turned upside down when a heavily pregnant woman is attacked in nearby woods. When she dies from her injuries, Maura is forced to perform a C-section to save the baby. Learning the woman was acting as a surrogate, Jane heads to the fertility clinic she had been assigned to. Crime drama, starring Angie Harmon and Sasha Alexander(n)

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star(n)

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A car crash leaves Dalziel suspended from duty pending an investigation into drink-driving allegations. Pascoe probes the source of the claims against his boss, and exposes a web of conspiracy surrounding the violent death of an elderly Army veteran - all the while coping with being a dad of the Nineties and dealing with his senile father-in-law. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star(n)
